peopleAlsoAsk.question: Are antique guns valuable?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Antique guns hold their value best when they remain as close to their original state as possible. Collectors seek guns that represent a snapshot of history—flaws and all. The genuine signs of wear, such as natural discoloration, enhance the gun's character and appeal to collectors who value authenticity.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: 10 Factors That Determine The Value Of Your Antique Guns

peopleAlsoAsk.question: Can you sell vintage toy guns on ebay?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Replica, toys, prop guns or other imitation firearms can be sold as long as they follow these rules: The seller follows all applicable government regulations. The item has a blaze orange barrel plug permanently attached. The picture shows the actual item for sale.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Replica, toy, and prop firearms policy - eBay

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What is a vintage cap gun?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: A cap gun, cap pistol, or cap rifle is a toy gun that creates a loud sound simulating a gunshot and smoke when a small percussion cap is ignited by a hammer hitting the gun powder. Cap guns were originally made of cast iron, but after World War II were made of zinc alloy, and most newer models are made of plastic.

peopleAlsoAsk.question: Are toy guns that look real legal?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Part 272 of Title 15 of the Code of Federal Regulations on foreign commerce and trade (15 CFR 272) states that "no person shall manufacture, enter into commerce, ship, transport, or receive any toy, look-alike, or imitation firearm" without approved markings; these may include an orange tip, orange barrel plug, ...
